metadata.dc:author: Mérida Velasco, José Ramón
metadata.dc:description: The temporomandibular joint (TMJ) is a complex joint due its development and filogeny. This complexity explains the lack of descriptions of the posterior joint capsule. Nowadays it is necessary to establish the limits of this joint part owing to a correct arthroscopic access. Dissecting human cadavers it will determine this joint segment and describe its anatomic relations.
metadata.dc:title: Está definido el segmento posterior de la cápsula articular temporomandibular?
[Is the posterior segment of the temporomandibular joint capsule well defined?].
metadata.dc:publisher: Anales de la Real Academia Nacional de Medicina
